etymology.description: silk rope for binding objects, original form of 紀
etymology.interpretation: 己 originally represented a silk rope used for binding, which later evolved in meaning to refer to oneself or self. While it is a simple and easily recognizable character, its difference from visually similar characters like 已 or 巳 is crucial in understanding its unique identity and usage.

examples.pinyin: Tā duì zìjǐ hěn yǒu xìnxīn.
examples.english: He has a lot of confidence in himself.
